term: Rules of debate in the Convention
content:
-secrecy: didn’t want outside influence and they wanted them to have the opportunity to change their mind without being flamed for it
	-you could only speak twice about a specific issue and you couldn’t speak for your second until everyone else had spoken about it
this prevented public opinion / viewpoint

No decision was final on any part of the constitution until it was voted on as a whole.
	-if someone had favorability over certain articles versus others it might influence them to vote for the whole doc despite not liking some of the articles
	-also leads to greater cohesion of the document as a whole
